metadata.title: CVE-2019-10160 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A security regression of CVE-2019-9636 was discovered in python sincecommit d537ab0ff9767ef024f26246899728f0116b1ec3 affecting versions 2.7,3.5, 3.6, 3.7 and from v3.8.0a4 through v3.8.0b1, which still allows anattacker to exploit CVE-2019-9636 by abusing the user and password parts ofa URL. When an application parses user-supplied URLs to store cookies,authentication credentials, or other kind of information, it is possiblefor an attacker to provide specially crafted URLs to make the applicationlocate host-related information (e.g. cookies, authentication data) andsend them to a different host than where it should, unlike if the URLs hadbeen correctly parsed. The result of an attack may vary based on theapplication.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
python2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
No subscription required

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6 - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6-stdlib - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6-testsuite - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6 - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6-examples - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6-minimal - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6-venv - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1').
python3.6 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.8-1~18.04.2').
python3.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
